comment: Avoid taking this professor unless deemed necessary. Tough grader when it comes to papers and will not let you know what needs to be improved. Also, does not respond back to emails. Went the entire semester emailing about a group member to confirm if they were still in the class or not due to non-participation in group project and never responded.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Ashby's lectures, grading, and class content is disorganized. On the midterm, there was one term I was unfamiliar with and got wrong, only to find it four chapters ahead in the textbook (five weeks later). Grading can be harsh- I got 20 points taken off of a discussion post for an incorrect citation. An A is possible, but you need to self-teach

Lectures are useless, mumbles & reads off the powerpoint. 3 required textbooks. No direction given on what material will be on quizzes/tests. Group project that is absolutely pointless. Unorganized & w/it being an online class, organization is key to succeeding. Avoid taking her. You have to do her job as the prof & your job as the student.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Test heavy

comment: Great teacher! Very passionate about the material and I genuinely enjoyed listening to her lectures every week. Weekly quizzes were quite simple but tests proved to be pretty difficult. Midterm and Final are lockdown browser. Final is not cumulative. A lot of material but do the reading and you will do fine.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: Dr. Ashby is way too disorganized to be teaching. She does not know what she's doing. Sets her students up for failure. Messy and sloppy. Only took her class bc I was interested in the subject. My grades do not reflect my knowledge because of how poorly ran her class is. She cannot teach even if her life depended on it. Impossible to pass.

Unreasonable, unprepared, and uninvested. Two heavily weighed exams each over 7+ chapters, with no guidelines of what to study. Questions in the exams were illogically specific. I might have been the only person who made an A in the class because I read through the entire textbook (her lectures were useless). She also didn't respond to emails.

Do not take her, even if you need the credit. She will kill your GPA and social life. I got As in all my other classes, but this one was beyond hard. She gives you no study guides so you have to read 9 chapters, which none of the information from the textbook is on the test. Oh, and every test is a lockdown browser btw!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: The most apathetic, lazy professor I have ever had. She hasn't updated her syllabus or lectures in what seems like years. She will make you read from 3 different text books and make you guess what will be on exams. Doesn't offer help or extra credit and is rude. She shouldn't be allowed to teach anyone. DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS FOR ANY REASON EVER!!!!

She will make you hate Psychology. She does not care about students and will talk down to you. She "doesn't believe in study guides" and her way is the only way. All quizzes are timed and the two exams total to 50% of your grade, it is ridiculous. There are 3 required textbooks and over 2 hour lectures.

I'm a typical A+/B+ student. I had never withdrawn from a class before this course. After 3 weeks in this class, multiple intensive assignments, & aggressive rubrics that my group partners followed to a T, we all received failing grades on work- needless to say 80% of our class withdrew ASAP... prof didn't help students learn/grow & didn't care
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Tough grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Huge group project on first day. Requires 3 textbooks with heavy reading in all of them every week. Her lectures and PowerPoints are very confusing and hard to understand what we need to actually know for test and quizzes. Quizzes are timed and very confusing no matter how much you study. Don't take... you will struggle, no guidance.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: She is one of the worst professors I have ever had. All she does is read from the slides and then expects us to read three- yes, THREE- textbooks every week as the bare minimum. I hated going to class every time. If you care about yourself, don't take this class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: She knows what she's talking about but her class gave me a headache trying to decipher what she wanted us to study! There were 3 different textbooks, never knew which one was going to be on quizzes/exams. Lots of busy work, goes so off-topic with the lectures. I swear I studied so hard for her exams and never made above a C on any of them.

She's half decent and lazy. Inactive professor, instructions are outdated (misleading due dates) and don't make sense. Makes the class harder than it needs to be, but its ultimately not the worst. Two major exams, and a few quizzes, along with assignments ( small papers and discussion posts). The group project was a pain, being that it was online.

Took for Psych 3355, gives a group project on the first day of class. requires 3 textbooks, with HEAVY reading each week (5+ chapters). do not take her class unless you have to. You must attend class online or else you wont pass.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: My least favorite professor. She doesn't even attempt to keep her instructions current or avoid thoroughly confusing students. When faced with very impactful errors, including misleading typos, she chuckles at herself, changes nothing, and does not address the issue for other students. Her integrity as professor is very low. Shes tricky.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Human Sexuality went so badly. The six discussion posts/replies had to be videos. Two papers with no little guidance and harsh grading. And a final exam that was worth 200 of the 350 points for the total grade. The final was 200 questions in two hours, lockdown browser + webcam, no study guide. She just told us to do the reading (600 pgs).
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things
